docs.text: General Cell Annotation Open Standard General, open-standard schema for cell annotations URI: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Name: General_Cell_Annotation_Open_Standard Classes Class Description Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. AutomatedAnnotation A set of fields for recording the details of the automated annotation algorithm used. (Common 'automated annotation methods' would include PopV, Azimuth, CellTypist, scArches, etc.) Labelset None Review None Taxonomy None Slots Slot Description algorithm_name The name of the algorithm Class: Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. Annotation : cell_label Annotation : cell_ontology_term Annotation : cell_ontology_term_id Annotation --> "0..1" CellTypeEnum : cell_ontology_term_id click CellTypeEnum href "../CellTypeEnum" Annotation : labelset Annotation : marker_gene_evidence Annotation : rationale Annotation : rationale_dois Annotation : reviews Annotation --> "*" Review : reviews click Review href "../Review" Annotation : synonyms Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance labelset 1 String The unique name of the set of cell annotations direct cell_label 1 String This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i direct cell_fullname 0..1 String This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in `cell_l... direct cell_ontology_term_id 0..1 CellTypeEnum This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www direct cell_ontology_term 0..1 String This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_... direct cell_ids * String Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the A... direct rationale 0..1 String The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence for the... direct rationale_dois * String direct marker_gene_evidence * String Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the An... direct synonyms * String List of synonyms direct reviews * Review direct author_annotation_fields 0..1 String A dictionary of author defined key value pairs annotating the cell set direct Usages used by used in type used Taxonomy annotations range Annotation Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cell_annotation_schema:Annotation native cell_annotation_schema:Annotation LinkML Source Direct name: Annotation description: 'A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slots: - labelset - cell_label - cell_fullname - cell_ontology_term_id - cell_ontology_term - cell_ids - rationale - rationale_dois - marker_gene_evidence - synonyms - reviews - author_annotation_fields Induced name: Annotation description: 'A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard attributes: labelset: name: labelset description: "The unique name of the set of cell annotations. 
Each cell within\ \ the AnnData/Seurat file MUST be associated with a 'cell_label' value in order\ \ for this to be a valid 'cellannotation_setname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: CAS:has_labelset alias: labelset owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string required: true cell_label: name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate\ \ cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations\ \ are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details.\ \ 
Certain key words have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'`\ \ is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g.\ \ few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is\ \ explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete,\ \ i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string required: true cell_fullname: name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed\ \ in `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length\ \ term, this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used\ \ in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same\ \ cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'.\ \ However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'.\ \ 

EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended\ \ by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label',\ \ but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine\ \ cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string cell_ontology_term_id: name: cell_ontology_term_id description: 'This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field ''cell_label'' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of ''cell_label'' is ''relay interneuron'', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: CellTypeEnum cell_ontology_term: name: cell_ontology_term description: This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_term_id' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: cell_ontology_term owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string cell_ids: name: cell_ids description: Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the AnnData/Seurat matrix. Any and all cell barcode sequences/UUIDs MUST be included in the AnnData/Seurat matrix. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: CAS:has_cellid alias: cell_ids owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string multivalued: true rationale: name: rationale description: "The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence\ \ for their cell annotations. 
Researchers are encouraged to use this field\ \ to cite relevant publications in-line using standard academic citations of\ \ the form `(Zheng et al., 2020)` This human-readable free-text MUST be encoded\ \ as a single string.
All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under\ \ rationale_dois. There MUST be a 2000-character limit." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: rationale owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string rationale_dois: name: rationale_dois from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: rationale_dois owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string multivalued: true marker_gene_evidence: name: marker_gene_evidence description: Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: marker_gene_evidence owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string multivalued: true synonyms: name: synonyms description: List of synonyms from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: synonyms owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string multivalued: true reviews: name: reviews from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: reviews owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: Review multivalued: true author_annotation_fields: name: author_annotation_fields description: A dictionary of author defined key value pairs annotating the cell set. The names and aims of these fields MUST not clash with official annotation fields. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: author_annotation_fields owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation range: string

It MUST be a string of the algorithm's name. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: algorithm_name owner: AutomatedAnnotation domain_of: - AutomatedAnnotation range: string required: true algorithm_version: name: algorithm_version description: The version of the algorithm used (if applicable). It MUST be a string of the algorithm's version, which is typically in the format '[MAJOR].[MINOR]', but other versioning systems are permitted (based on the algorithm's versioning). from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: algorithm_version owner: AutomatedAnnotation domain_of: - AutomatedAnnotation range: string required: true algorithm_repo_url: name: algorithm_repo_url description: This field denotes the URL of the version control repository associated with the algorithm used (if applicable). It MUST be a string of a valid URL. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: algorithm_repo_url owner: AutomatedAnnotation domain_of: - AutomatedAnnotation range: string required: true reference_location: name: reference_location description: "This field denotes a valid URL of the annotated dataset that was\ \ the source of annotated reference data. \nThis MUST be a string of a valid\ \ URL. The concept of a 'reference' specifically refers to 'annotation transfer'\ \ algorithms, whereby a 'reference' dataset is used to transfer cell annotations\ \ to the 'query' dataset." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 alias: reference_location owner: AutomatedAnnotation domain_of: - AutomatedAnnotation range: string

docs.text:
Slot: cell_fullname _This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in cell_label by the author. (If the value in cell_label is the full-length term, this field will contain the same value.) _ _NOTE: any reserved word used in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. _ __ _EXAMPLE 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'. However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'. _ __ EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label', but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'. URI: skos:preflabel Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some s... no Properties Range: String Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self skos:preflabel native cell_annotation_schema:cell_fullname LinkML Source name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in\ \ `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length term,\ \ this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used in the\ \ field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE 1: Given the\ \ matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same cell(s), then\ \ users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'. However, the\ \ abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended by the author\ \ 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label', but as full-length\ \ term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MUST be placed in\ \ the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname domain_of: - Annotation range: string
docs.title: Slot: cell_fullname

docs.text:
Slot: cell_label _This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details. _ Certain key words have been reserved: - 'doublets' is reserved for encoding cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis - 'junk' is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g. few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads - 'unknown' is explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know' - 'NA' is incomplete, i.e. no cell annotation was provided URI: rdfs:label Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some s... no Properties Range: String Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self rdfs:label native cell_annotation_schema:cell_label LinkML Source name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells,\ \ i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations are exceptable\ \ in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details. 
Certain key words\ \ have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding cells defined as\ \ doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g. few genes detected, high fraction\ \ of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author\ \ does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete, i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label domain_of: - Annotation range: string required: true
docs.title: Slot: cell_label

docs.text: Slot: cell_ontology_term_id This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). __ NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field 'cell_label' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of 'cell_label' is 'relay interneuron', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it's the broader term 'interneuron' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099. URI: RO:0002473 Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some s... no Properties Range: CellTypeEnum Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self RO:0002473 native cell_annotation_schema:cell_ontology_term_id LinkML Source name: cell_ontology_term_id description: 'This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field ''cell_label'' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of ''cell_label'' is ''relay interneuron'', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id domain_of: - Annotation range: CellTypeEnum

docs.text: Slot: rationale _The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence for their cell annotations. _ Researchers are encouraged to use this field to cite relevant publications in-line using standard academic citations of the form (Zheng et al., 2020) This human-readable free-text MUST be encoded as a single string. All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under rationale_dois. There MUST be a 2000-character limit. docs.text: Slot: reference_location _This field denotes a valid URL of the annotated dataset that was the source of annotated reference data. _ This MUST be a string of a valid URL. The concept of a 'reference' specifically refers to 'annotation transfer' algorithms, whereby a 'reference' dataset is used to transfer cell annotations to the 'query' dataset. docs.text: General Cell Annotation Open Standard General, open-standard schema for cell annotations URI: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Name: General_Cell_Annotation_Open_Standard Classes Class Description Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. BicanAnnotation None AnnotationTransfer None AutomatedAnnotation A set of fields for recording the details of the automated annotation algorithm used. (Common 'automated annotation methods' would include PopV, Azimuth, CellTypist, scArches, etc.) Cell None Labelset None BicanLabelset None Review None Taxonomy None BicanTaxonomy None Slots Slot docs.text:
Class: Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. URI: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:Annotation classDiagram class Annotation click Annotation href "../Annotation" Annotation <|-- BicanAnnotation click BicanAnnotation href "../BicanAnnotation" Annotation : author_annotation_fields Annotation : cell_fullname Annotation : cell_ids Annotation : cell_label Annotation : cell_ontology_term Annotation : cell_ontology_term_id Annotation --> "0..1" CellTypeEnum : cell_ontology_term_id click CellTypeEnum href "../CellTypeEnum" Annotation : labelset Annotation : marker_gene_evidence Annotation : rationale Annotation : rationale_dois Annotation : reviews Annotation --> "*" Review : reviews click Review href "../Review" Annotation : synonyms Inheritance Annotation BicanAnnotation Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance labelset 1 String The unique name of the set of cell annotations direct cell_label 1 String This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i direct cell_fullname 0..1 String This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in `cell_l... direct cell_ontology_term_id 0..1 CellTypeEnum This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www direct cell_ontology_term 0..1 String This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_... direct cell_ids * String Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the A... direct rationale 0..1 String The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence for the... direct rationale_dois String This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i direct cell_fullname 0..1 String This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in `cell_l... direct cell_ontology_term_id 0..1 CellTypeEnum This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www direct cell_ontology_term 0..1 String This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_... direct cell_ids * String Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the A... direct rationale 0..1 String The free-text rationale which users in type used Taxonomy annotations range Annotation Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:Annotation native https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:Annotation LinkML Source Direct name: Annotation description: 'A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slots: - labelset - cell_label - cell_fullname - cell_ontology_term_id - cell_ontology_term - cell_ids - rationale - rationale_dois - marker_gene_evidence - synonyms - reviews - author_annotation_fields attributes: labelset: name: labelset description: "The unique name of the set of cell annotations. 
Each cell within\ \ the AnnData/Seurat file MUST be associated with a 'cell_label' value in order\ \ for this to be a valid 'cellannotation_setname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_labelset alias: labelset owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_label: name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate\ \ cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations\ \ are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details.\ \ 
Certain key words have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'`\ \ is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g.\ \ few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is\ \ explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete,\ \ i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_fullname: name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed\ \ in `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length\ \ term, this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used\ \ in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same\ \ cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'.\ \ However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'.\ \ 

EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended\ \ by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label',\ \ but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine\ \ cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ontology_term_id: name: cell_ontology_term_id description: 'This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field ''cell_label'' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of ''cell_label'' is ''relay interneuron'', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: CellTypeEnum cell_ontology_term: name: cell_ontology_term description: This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_term_id' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_ontology_term owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ids: name: cell_ids description: Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the AnnData/Seurat matrix. Any and all cell barcode sequences/UUIDs MUST be included in the AnnData/Seurat matrix. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_cellid alias: cell_ids owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true rationale: name: rationale description: "The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence\ \ for their cell annotations. 
Researchers are encouraged to use this field\ \ to cite relevant publications in-line using standard academic citations of\ \ the form `(Zheng et al., 2020)` This human-readable free-text MUST be encoded\ \ as a single string.
All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under\ \ rationale_dois. There MUST be a 2000-character limit." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: rationale owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string rationale_dois: name: rationale_dois from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: rationale_dois owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true marker_gene_evidence: name: marker_gene_evidence description: Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: marker_gene_evidence owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true synonyms: name: synonyms description: List of synonyms from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: synonyms owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true reviews: name: reviews from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: reviews owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: Review multivalued: true author_annotation_fields: name: author_annotation_fields description: A dictionary of author defined key value pairs annotating the cell set. The names and aims of these fields MUST not clash with official annotation fields. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: author_annotation_fields owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string Induced name: Annotation description: 'A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard attributes: labelset: name: labelset description: "The unique name of the set of cell annotations. 
Each cell within\ \ the AnnData/Seurat file MUST be associated with a 'cell_label' value in order\ \ for this to be a valid 'cellannotation_setname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_labelset alias: labelset owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_label: name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate\ \ cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations\ \ are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details.\ \ 
Certain key words have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'`\ \ is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g.\ \ few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is\ \ explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete,\ \ i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_fullname: name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed\ \ in `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length\ \ term, this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used\ \ in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same\ \ cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'.\ \ However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'.\ \ 

EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended\ \ by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label',\ \ but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine\ \ cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ontology_term_id: name: cell_ontology_term_id description: 'This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field ''cell_label'' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of ''cell_label'' is ''relay interneuron'', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: CellTypeEnum cell_ontology_term: name: cell_ontology_term description: This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_term_id' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_ontology_term owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ids: name: cell_ids description: Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the AnnData/Seurat matrix. Any and all cell barcode sequences/UUIDs MUST be included in the AnnData/Seurat matrix. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_cellid alias: cell_ids owner: Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true rationale: name: rationale description: "The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence\ \ for their cell annotations.

docs.text: A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:BicanAnnotation native https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:BicanAnnotation LinkML Source Direct name: Bican_Annotation from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard is_a: Annotation slots: - cell_set_accession - parent_cell_set_accession - transferred_annotations - cells - negative_marker_gene_evidence attributes: cell_set_accession: name: cell_set_accession description: An identifier that can be used to consistently refer to the set of cells being annotated, even if the cell_label changes. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_set_accession owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: string parent_cell_set_accession: name: parent_cell_set_accession description: A list of accessions of cell sets that subsume this cell set. This can be used to compose hierarchies of annotated cell sets, built from a fixed set of clusters. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0015003 alias: parent_cell_set_accession owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: string transferred_annotations: name: transferred_annotations from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: transferred_annotations owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: AnnotationTransfer multivalued: true cells: name: cells description: By convention this is only used for annotation transfer labelsets. It MUST not be combined with the 'cell_ids' field. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cells owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: Cell multivalued: true negative_marker_gene_evidence: name: negative_marker_gene_evidence description: Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: negative_marker_gene_evidence owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true labelset: name: labelset description: "The unique name of the set of cell annotations. 
Each cell within\ \ the AnnData/Seurat file MUST be associated with a 'cell_label' value in order\ \ for this to be a valid 'cellannotation_setname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_labelset alias: labelset owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_label: name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate\ \ cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations\ \ are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details.\ \ 
Certain key words have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'`\ \ is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g.\ \ few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is\ \ explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete,\ \ i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_fullname: name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed\ \ in `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length\ \ term, this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used\ \ in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same\ \ cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'.\ \ However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'.\ \ 

EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended\ \ by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label',\ \ but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine\ \ cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ontology_term_id: name: cell_ontology_term_id description: 'This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field ''cell_label'' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of ''cell_label'' is ''relay interneuron'', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: CellTypeEnum cell_ontology_term: name: cell_ontology_term description: This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_term_id' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_ontology_term owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ids: name: cell_ids description: Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the AnnData/Seurat matrix. Any and all cell barcode sequences/UUIDs MUST be included in the AnnData/Seurat matrix. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_cellid alias: cell_ids owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true rationale: name: rationale description: "The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence\ \ for their cell annotations. 
Researchers are encouraged to use this field\ \ to cite relevant publications in-line using standard academic citations of\ \ the form `(Zheng et al., 2020)` This human-readable free-text MUST be encoded\ \ as a single string.
All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under\ \ rationale_dois. There MUST be a 2000-character limit." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: rationale owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string rationale_dois: name: rationale_dois from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: rationale_dois owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true marker_gene_evidence: name: marker_gene_evidence description: Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: marker_gene_evidence owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true synonyms: name: synonyms description: List of synonyms from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: synonyms owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true reviews: name: reviews from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: reviews owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: Review multivalued: true author_annotation_fields: name: author_annotation_fields description: A dictionary of author defined key value pairs annotating the cell set. The names and aims of these fields MUST not clash with official annotation fields. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: author_annotation_fields owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string Induced name: Bican_Annotation from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard is_a: Annotation attributes: cell_set_accession: name: cell_set_accession description: An identifier that can be used to consistently refer to the set of cells being annotated, even if the cell_label changes. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_set_accession owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: string parent_cell_set_accession: name: parent_cell_set_accession description: A list of accessions of cell sets that subsume this cell set. This can be used to compose hierarchies of annotated cell sets, built from a fixed set of clusters. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0015003 alias: parent_cell_set_accession owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: string transferred_annotations: name: transferred_annotations from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: transferred_annotations owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: AnnotationTransfer multivalued: true cells: name: cells description: By convention this is only used for annotation transfer labelsets. It MUST not be combined with the 'cell_ids' field. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cells owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: Cell multivalued: true negative_marker_gene_evidence: name: negative_marker_gene_evidence description: Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: negative_marker_gene_evidence owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true labelset: name: labelset description: "The unique name of the set of cell annotations. 
Each cell within\ \ the AnnData/Seurat file MUST be associated with a 'cell_label' value in order\ \ for this to be a valid 'cellannotation_setname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_labelset alias: labelset owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_label: name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate\ \ cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations\ \ are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details.\ \ 
Certain key words have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'`\ \ is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g.\ \ few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is\ \ explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete,\ \ i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true cell_fullname: name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed\ \ in `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length\ \ term, this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used\ \ in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same\ \ cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'.\ \ However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'.\ \ 

EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended\ \ by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label',\ \ but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine\ \ cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ontology_term_id: name: cell_ontology_term_id description: 'This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field ''cell_label'' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of ''cell_label'' is ''relay interneuron'', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: CellTypeEnum cell_ontology_term: name: cell_ontology_term description: This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_term_id' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_ontology_term owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ids: name: cell_ids description: Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the AnnData/Seurat matrix. Any and all cell barcode sequences/UUIDs MUST be included in the AnnData/Seurat matrix. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_cellid alias: cell_ids owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true rationale: name: rationale description: "The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence\ \ for their cell annotations.

All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under\ \ rationale_dois. In this case, it''s the broader term ''interneuron'' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: RO:0002473 alias: cell_ontology_term_id owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: CellTypeEnum cell_ontology_term: name: cell_ontology_term description: This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_term_id' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cell_ontology_term owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string cell_ids: name: cell_ids description: Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the AnnData/Seurat matrix. Any and all cell barcode sequences/UUIDs MUST be included in the AnnData/Seurat matrix. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: CAS:has_cellid alias: cell_ids owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true rationale: name: rationale description: "The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence\ \ for their cell annotations. 
Researchers are encouraged to use this field\ \ to cite relevant publications in-line using standard academic citations of\ \ the form `(Zheng et al., 2020)` This human-readable free-text MUST be encoded\ \ as a single string.
All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under\ \ rationale_dois. There MUST be a 2000-character limit." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: rationale owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string rationale_dois: name: rationale_dois from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: rationale_dois owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true marker_gene_evidence: name: marker_gene_evidence description: Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: marker_gene_evidence owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true synonyms: name: synonyms description: List of synonyms from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: synonyms owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string multivalued: true reviews: name: reviews from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: reviews owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: Review multivalued: true author_annotation_fields: name: author_annotation_fields description: A dictionary of author defined key value pairs annotating the cell set. The names and aims of these fields MUST not clash with official annotation fields. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: author_annotation_fields owner: Bican_Annotation domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string

docs.text: name: Bican_Taxonomy from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard is_a: Taxonomy slot_usage: labelsets: name: labelsets domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: Bican_Labelset annotations: name: annotations domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: Bican_Annotation attributes: matrix_file_id: name: matrix_file_id description: A resolvable ID for a cell by gene matrix file in the form namespace:accession, e.g. CellXGene_dataset:8e10f1c4-8e98-41e5-b65f-8cd89a887122. Please see https://github.com/cellannotation/cell-annotation-schema/registry/registry.json for supported namespaces. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: matrix_file_id owner: Bican_Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string title: name: title description: The title of the dataset. This MUST be less than or equal to 200 characters. e.g. 'Human retina cell atlas - retinal ganglion cells'. from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: title owner: Bican_Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string required: true description: name: description description: The description of the dataset. e.g. 'A total of 15 retinal ganglion cell clusters were identified from over 99K retinal ganglion cell nuclei in the current atlas. Utilizing previous characterized markers from macaque, 5 clusters can be annotated.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard slot_uri: IAO:0000115 alias: description owner: Bican_Taxonomy domain_of: - Labelset - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy - Bican_Labelset range: string cellannotation_schema_version: name: cellannotation_schema_version description: 'The schema version, the cell annotation open standard. This MUST be a string. The recommended versioning format is `'[MAJOR].[MINOR].[PATCH]'` as defined by Semantic Versioning 2.0.0, https://semver.org/ from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cellannotation_version owner: Bican_Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string cellannotation_url: name: cellannotation_url description: A persistent URL of all cell annotations published (per dataset). from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cellannotation_url owner: Bican_Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string author_list: name: author_list description: This field stores a list of users who are included in the project as collaborators, regardless of their specific role. Current version MUST follow 0.1.0 This versioning MUST follow the format `''[MAJOR].[MINOR].[PATCH]''` as defined by Semantic Versioning 2.0.0, https://semver.org/' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cellannotation_schema_version owner: Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string cellannotation_timestamp: name: cellannotation_timestamp description: The timestamp of all cell annotations published (per dataset). This MUST be a string in the format `'%yyyy-%mm-%dd %hh:%mm:%ss'` from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cellannotation_timestamp owner: Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string cellannotation_version: name: cellannotation_version description: The version for all cell annotations published (per dataset). This MUST be a string. The recommended versioning format is `'[MAJOR].[MINOR].[PATCH]'` as defined by Semantic Versioning 2.0.0, https://semver.org/ from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cellannotation_version owner: Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string cellannotation_url: name: cellannotation_url description: A persistent URL of all cell annotations published (per dataset). from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: cellannotation_url owner: Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string author_list: name: author_list description: This field stores a list of users who are included in the project as collaborators, regardless of their specific role. An example list; '['John Smith', 'Cody Miller', 'Sarah Jones']' from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard alias: author_list owner: Taxonomy domain_of: - Taxonomy - Bican_Taxonomy range: string author_name: name: author_name description: Primary author's name. docs.text:
Slot: cell_fullname _This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in cell_label by the author. (If the value in cell_label is the full-length term, this field will contain the same value.) _ _NOTE: any reserved word used in the field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. _ __ _EXAMPLE 1: Given the matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same cell(s), then users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'. However, the abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'. _ __ EXAMPLE 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended by the author 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label', but as full-length term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MUST be placed in the field 'cell_fullname'. URI: skos:preflabel Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some s... no BicanAnnotation no Properties Range: String Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self skos:preflabel native https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:cell_fullname LinkML Source name: cell_fullname description: "This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in\ \ `cell_label` by the author. (If the value in `cell_label` is the full-length term,\ \ this field will contain the same value.) 
NOTE: any reserved word used in the\ \ field 'cell_label' MUST match the value of this field. 

EXAMPLE 1: Given the\ \ matching terms 'LC' and 'luminal cell' used to annotate the same cell(s), then\ \ users could use either terms as values in the field 'cell_label'. However, the\ \ abbreviation 'LC' CANNOT be provided in the field 'cell_fullname'. 

EXAMPLE\ \ 2: Either the abbreviation 'AC' or the full-length term intended by the author\ \ 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MAY be placed in the field 'cell_label', but as full-length\ \ term naming this biological entity, 'GABAergic amacrine cell' MUST be placed in\ \ the field 'cell_fullname'." from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: skos:preflabel alias: cell_fullname domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string

docs.text:
Slot: cell_label _This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details. _ Certain key words have been reserved: - 'doublets' is reserved for encoding cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis - 'junk' is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g. few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads - 'unknown' is explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know' - 'NA' is incomplete, i.e. no cell annotation was provided URI: rdfs:label Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some s... no BicanAnnotation no Properties Range: String Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self rdfs:label native https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard/:cell_label LinkML Source name: cell_label description: "This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells,\ \ i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations are exceptable\ \ in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details. 
Certain key words\ \ have been reserved:
- `'doublets'` is reserved for encoding cells defined as\ \ doublets based on some computational analysis
- `'junk'` is reserved for encoding\ \ cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g. few genes detected, high fraction\ \ of mitochondrial reads
- `'unknown'` is explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author\ \ does not know'
- `'NA'` is incomplete, i.e. no cell annotation was provided" from_schema: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard rank: 1000 slot_uri: rdfs:label alias: cell_label domain_of: - Annotation - Bican_Annotation range: string required: true
docs.title: Slot: cell_label

docs.text: _This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i.e. the preferred cell label name used by the author. Abbreviations are exceptable in this field; refer to 'cell_fullname' for related details. _ Certain key words have been reserved: - 'doublets' is reserved for encoding cells defined as doublets based on some computational analysis - 'junk' is reserved for encoding cells that failed sequencing for some reason, e.g. few genes detected, high fraction of mitochondrial reads - 'unknown' is explicitly reserved for unknown or 'author does not know' - 'NA' is incomplete, i.e. no cell annotation was provided URI: rdfs:label

docs.text: Slot: cell_ontology_term_id This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/pcl) or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols4/ontologies/fbbt). __ NOTE: The closest available ontology term matching the value within the field 'cell_label' (at the time of publication) MUST be used. For example, if the value of 'cell_label' is 'relay interneuron', but this entity does not yet exist in the ontology, users must choose the closest available term in the CL ontology. In this case, it's the broader term 'interneuron' i.e. https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl/terms?obo_id=CL:0000099. docs.text: Slot: rationale _The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence for their cell annotations. _ Researchers are encouraged to use this field to cite relevant publications in-line using standard academic citations of the form (Zheng et al., 2020) This human-readable free-text MUST be encoded as a single string. All references cited SHOULD be listed using DOIs under rationale_dois. There MUST be a 2000-character limit. docs.text: General Cell Annotation Open Standard General, open-standard schema for cell annotations URI: https://w3id.org/Cellular-Semantics/General-Cell-Annotation-Open-Standard Name: General_Cell_Annotation_Open_Standard Classes Class Description Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. CapAnnotation None AutomatedAnnotation A set of fields for recording the details of the automated annotation algorithm used. (Common 'automated annotation methods' would include PopV, Azimuth, CellTypist, scArches, etc.) Labelset None Review None Taxonomy None CapTaxonomy None Slots Slot Description algorithm_name The name of the algorithm used algorithm_repo_url This field denotes the URL of the version control repository associated with ... algorithm_version The version of the algorithm used (if applicable) annotation_method The method used for creating the cell annotations annotations author_annotation_fields A dictionary of author defined key value pairs annotating the cell set author_contact Primary author's contact author_list This field stores a list of users who are included in the project as collabor... author_name Primary author's name automated_annotation canonical_marker_genes A list of gene names considered to be canonical markers for the biological en... cap_dataset_url A persistent URL of the dataset on CAP cap_publication_description The description of the publication on CAP cap_publication_title The title of the publication on CAP (i cap_publication_url A persistent URL of the publication on CAP category_cell_ontology_exists Decision by user whether this biological entity exists in the current Cell On... category_cell_ontology_term The human-readable name assigned to the value of 'category_cell_ontology_term... category_cell_ontology_term_id The ID from either the Cell Ontology or from some ontology that extends it by... category_fullname Any term denoting a biological entity which the author associates as the near... cell_fullname This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity listed in `cell_l... cell_ids Cell barcode sequences/UUIDs used to uniquely identify the cells within the A... cell_label This denotes any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, i cell_ontology_assessment Free-text field for researchers to express disagreements with any aspect of t... cell_ontology_exists Decision by user whether this biological entity exists in the current Cell On... cell_ontology_term This MUST be the human-readable name assigned to the value of 'cell_ontology_... cell_ontology_term_id This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology (https://www cellannotation_schema_version The schema version, the cell annotation open standard cellannotation_timestamp The timestamp of all cell annotations published (per dataset) cellannotation_url A persistent URL of all cell annotations published (per dataset) cellannotation_version The version for all cell annotations published (per dataset) datestamp Time and date review was last edited description The description of the dataset explanation Free-text review of annotation id labelset The unique name of the set of cell annotations labelsets marker_gene_evidence Gene names explicitly used as evidence, which MUST be in the matrix of the An... matrix_file_id A resolvable ID for a cell by gene matrix file in the form namespace:accessio... name name of annotation key orcid Primary author's orcid publication_timestamp The timestamp of the CAP publication publication_version The (latest) version of the CAP publication rationale The free-text rationale which users provide as justification/evidence for the... rationale_dois reference_location This field denotes a valid URL of the annotated dataset that was the source o... review Reviewer's verdict on the annotation reviewer Review Author reviews synonyms List of synonyms title The title of the dataset Enumerations Enumeration Description AnnotationMethodOptions CellTypeEnum ReviewOptions Types Type Description Boolean A binary (true or false) value Curie a compact URI Date a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar DateOrDatetime Either a date or a datetime Datetime The combination of a date and time Decimal A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal speci... Double A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer An integer Jsonpath A string encoding a JSON Path Jsonpointer A string encoding a JSON Pointer Ncname Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model Objectidentifier A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model Sparqlpath A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path String A character string Time A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular... Uri a complete URI Uriorcurie a URI or a CURIE Subsets Subset Description

docs.text: Class Description Annotation A collection of fields recording a cell type/class/state annotation on some set of cells, supporting evidence and provenance. As this is intended as a general schema, compulsory fields are kept to a minimum. However, tools using this schema are encouarged to specify a larger set of compulsory fields for publication. Note: This schema deliberately allows for additional fields in order to support ad hoc user fields, new formal schema extensions and project/tool specific metadata. CapAnnotation None AutomatedAnnotation A set of fields for recording the details of the automated annotation algorithm used. (Common 'automated annotation methods' would include PopV, Azimuth, CellTypist, scArches, etc.) Labelset None Review None Taxonomy None CapTaxonomy None
